critique: The document describes an executive order by President Hayes in 1879 that cancels a previous order and establishes land reservations for the Pima and Maricopa Indians in Arizona. It defines the boundaries of these reservations and temporarily withdraws certain lands from sale and settlement to protect improvements made by the Indians. The document reflects a historical context of government interaction with Native American tribes, involving land allocation and protection of their interests, albeit within the framework of the time.
